name: phaseolus-coccineus
edibility: Edible green pods that turn purple
light: Full sun (6 or more hours of direct sunlight a day)
flower-description: Red flowers mid summer to frost; edible green pods that turn purple; seeds are black, mottled red
poison-symptoms: In large amounts, the raw or undercooked beans can cause severe nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea. Usually resolves within a few hours.
poison-toxic-principle: Trace amounts of phytohaemagglutinin, a lectin
